lead_paragraph: The Department of Homeless Services said that training staff members in all New York City shelters, where overdoses were the leading cause of death last fiscal year, is a top priority.

headline.print_headline: Few on Shelter Staffs Learn to Give Heroin Antidote
headline.main: Few Homeless Shelter Workers Are Trained to Administer Heroin Antidote

snippet: The Department of Homeless Services said that training staff members in all New York City shelters, where overdoses were the leading cause of death last fiscal year, is a top priority....
abstract: New York State law has made heroin overdose antidote Narcan available over counter and protects those who administer it from liability, but only 18 percent of city homeless shelters have staff trained in administering antidote; overdoses are leading cause of death among homeless people  in shelters; Homeless Services Dept says training more employees is top priority.
